data.title: City of Longmont
data.meta_description: The history of Longmont, Colorado, from the earliest human habitation approximately 14,000 years ago, through the founding of Longmont by a group from Chicago, and the 20th and 21st century history.
data.text:
About the Photo collection:

The Longmont Museum holds more than 80,000 photographs of Longmont and the surrounding area, from the 1860s to the present. This collection is made possible by the many people who have donated photographs since the Museum began collecting in 1940.

Search the Catalog

Photos online:

More than 5,000 photographs are now available online, with more photos added as time permits.

Collection highlights:

800 photos from the early 1900s by Longmont photographer Charles W. Boynton

Photographs of Main Street in Longmont from 1872 to the 1970s.

The Great Western Sugar factory

Agriculture – plowing, planting and harvesting crops in the St. Vrain Valley

Photos from the Longmont Times-Call collection

Search the Catalog

All the Museum’s photos are available for research at the Longmont Archives.

Archives Location:

Longmont Museum and Cultural Center

400 Quail Road

Longmont, CO 80501

(303)651-8370

Regular Archives Hours:

Tuesday through Thursday 9 am to 5 pm, by appointment. Call the Archives at (303) 651-8969.

Photo reproduction and use fees

Photo reproduction costs

Minimum print order: $20

Prints

8×10 or smaller $10 + tax

11×14 $15 + tax

16×20 $30 + tax

20×30 $45 + tax

Larger sizes call (303) 651-8969

Prints are printed at a professional photo lab, allow 5 business days minimum for orders.

Digital files

Standard scan $15 + tax

Custom scan $25 + tax

Standard scans are at least 600 dpi, and files are saved as .tif format. Because of larger file sizes, it is usually not possible to email high-resolution image files. We do use the file-sharing program OneDrive to share large files.

Shipping and Handling

Prints smaller than 11×14 $15

11×14 and larger $25

Commercial Use Fees

All fees are per image

Display in office or business $25

Published use, less than 5,000 copies $15

More than 5,000 copies $25

Use on merchandise (postcards, T-shirts, etc.) $25

Commercial Television $100

All images must be credited: Photograph courtesy Longmont Museum.
